name: Whose Mic Is It Anyway - Mixed Open Mic Event
description: Whose Mic Is It Anyway?: Open Mic NightsIt’s yours!An open mic event welcoming all musicians, comedians, poets, storytellers, and more. Whether you’re a first-timer or a seasoned performer, this open mic is for you.It will be a safe space (rather, a safe stage) for you to try out your new stand-up material, to perform a poem close to your heart, or sing that song you’re not confident about. No pressure, no judgement; just a place for you to own the spotlight and give the world your best.And for our audience: come and enjoy a fun evening with some of the cities most talented artists. (See performers? We’re already cheering for you!)This event happens every alternate week, so if you can’t make it this time, you can sign up for it next time!About the host: OninthoughOften branded as a sarcastic soul and an outright cynic, Oninthough is infamous for his observational humour and satirical comedy, often coupled with political undertones and religious overtones.Oninthough was crowned "Lord of Humour" at UNMAAD 2021, IIM-Bangalore. His humour has been lauded by the likes of internationally acclaimed comedians like Craig Shoemaker, Matt Banwart, and Raj Poojara, and renowned Indian comedian Kunal Kamra. He has also been featured by DailyHunt, DNA, Times Now, Indian Express, Aaj Tak, WhatsHOT Bangalore, The Sarcastic Indian, and many other publications.He has performed for audiences across 20+ cities, 7 countries, and 3 continents. With over 75k shares across social media, his punchlines and humour jabs are amongst the most shared comedic content.

location.address: 21, 80 Feet Rd, Nirguna Mandir Layout, 4th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

name: Kavitayon Ki Dastak
description: Dialogues Cafe brings to you a Sunday full of kavitā and shāyari!If you love writing or just listening to Hindi poetry or couplets of shāyari or lyrical ghazals — we invite you to a poetic sundowner filled with hindi writing and sher-shāyari. Let`s get together for `Kavitāyon Ki Dastak`, an open mic — or rather an open mehfil — to set your mood and make you feel wholesome."utth ke mehfil se mat chale jānātum se raushan ye konā konā hai"Be a part of this community, share the love and lehzā with your words. Come join us to have agood time reciting, listening and absorbing the creativity of Hindi artists and shāyars. Wrap up your week with mellow vibes and be rejuvenated to start the next week afresh!Venue: Dialogues Café, KoramangalaEvery Second Sunday of the MonthTime: 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm

name: Dialogues with Books
description: Dialogues with Books Join us for our book club meetup every third Sunday of the month. Bring along your favorite book, the book you are currently reading, or any book that had an impact on you. Share your experience reading the book with fellow bibliophiles and participate in winding and fun discussions around the joy of reading. Do all this while sipping on coffee/tea or having a hot tasty snack from our cafe! Your Host - Bharat is an avid reader with a penchant for classical literature and philosophy. He also dabbles in writing with a diverse portfolio of works across tech, philosophy, magical realism and fantasy. His reading diet includes a mix of fiction and non-fiction with his favorite novels being The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald, The Movable feast by Hemmingway and Crime and Punishment by Dostoevsky.Note: Rs.100 as cover is part of the ticket price.

name: Dialogues Poetry Open Mic
description: Lovers of poetry and prose — this one is for you!Whether you like listening, reading or performing poems or short stories, be ready to be entertained. We are on a journey to create safe spaces for the writers in town — to share their writing with like-minded people and become part of our community. You can hold us accountable for making you have a good time!Join us at Dialogues Cafe,Koramangala from 7:30 PM onwards, on every 3rd Sunday

name: Baithak | Sarod Recital by Abhishek Borkar
description: About Courtyard BaithakThe Courtyard Baithak series is curated by tabla wizard and prodigy Trilochan Kampli, who with his uncompromising standards in music, evokes the best from every artist that he invites to perform. We are bringing musicians and audiences together on a sublime musical journey.Exclusive gatherings, quiet strains of exquisite music, and dedicated artists across selected genres - The Courtyard Baithak series promises a true classical musical experience.Please note: The ticket includes performance onlyAbout the ArtistAbhishek Borkar, a young and versatile sarod maestro, was born into a lineage of musicians and trained under his father, Pt. Shekhar Borkar, in the Maihar Senia Gharana. With a deep-rooted understanding of Hindustani classical music, Abhishek’s style seamlessly blends the essence of sarod, sitar, sarangi, and vocal traditions. Having performed at prestigious festivals like Sawai Gandharva, Kala Ghoda, and Darbar Festival, Abhishek’s music carries the influence of legends like Ustad Allauddin Khan, Ustad Ali Akbar Khan, and Pt. Nikhil Banerjee. Set in the heart of Bangalore, Courtyard’s open-air space will enhance the immersive experience of his music—allowing the depth of the sarod’s resonance to flow under the night sky, creating an intimate and transportive evening for all.Accompanied byTrilochan kampli on TablaThis event is supported by Samagata Foundation.Terms and Conditions1. The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.2. No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.3. Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.4. Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.5. Children aged 5 and older require a ticket.6. Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.7. Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.8. In the event of rain leading to a complete washout, Courtyard reserves the right to cancel the event. In such cases, a full refund for the ticket will be issued.

name: Streets, Stories & Sankey – Walk Through Bangalore
description: ​Step into the heart of Bangalore as we take a stroll through history, culture, and the city’s hidden gems. We begin our journey at Sankey Tank, a serene artificial lake in the western part of the city, surrounded by the vibrant neighborhoods of Malleshwaram, Vyalikaval, and Sadashivnagar. With its lush greenery and peaceful waters, Sankey Tank sets the perfect tone for a walk through Bangalore’s old-world charm.​From here, we head to Malleshwaram, a centuries-old residential area known for its rich local history, ancient temples, and iconic South Indian eateries.​Our journey then leads us through Sadashivnagar, a striking contrast to Malleshwaram’s energy. This elegant, tree-lined neighborhood is known for its expansive homes, tranquil ambiance, and glimpses of Bangalore’s colonial and modern architectural influences. Here, you’ll see how the city’s legacy gracefully blends with contemporary living.​We complete our loop back at Sankey Tank, where you can take in one last view of the lake as we wrap up this immersive experience.​📍 Starting Point: Sankey Tank (Free parking available)🚶‍♂️ Route: Sankey Tank → Malleshwaram → Sadashivnagar → Back to Sankey💬 What to Expect: Local perspective, hidden gems, and a taste of Bangalore’s unique characterWhether you're a history buff, a food lover, or enjoy the nostalgia of Bangalore’s past, you'll love it.Come walk with us. Let the city tell you its story. 🌿✨ 🌿✨

location.address: Sankey Tank, Kodandarampura, Malleshwaram, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560080

organizer.name: The Drawing Room
organizer.description: Welcome to The Drawing Room, a delightful gathering of art lovers, travel enthusiasts and wellness seekers. Here, we share experiences and embark on journeys together.

name: Her Sanctuary : The Embodied Retreat
description: Welcome to our Women's Embodied Retreat at the Studio.The aim of the event is to help us remember something that we often forget - that we are nature, we are the cycles, we are the different phases and seasons, and that we are connected with the world in deeply profound ways than we recognise. When we live in sync, harmony and connection with these inner cycles, we live in harmony with ourselves and the world around us.This Women’s Day Weekend, reconnect with your innate cycles and rhythms through movement, reflection, and sisterhood. Our journey together will honour the profound connection between our bodies and nature—embracing the seasons within us and celebrating the wisdom they bring.Event DescriptionThrough a dynamic empowerment flow led by Franzi and a deeply reflective women’s circle facilitated by Sanjana, we create space for self-awareness, healing, and transformation. A special first bleed ceremony will honour our journeys, allowing us to shift the narrative from shame to celebration and embrace the wisdom we carry.The event will begin with a grounding meditation and intention-setting practice guided by Sanjana, helping us connect with the feminine and prepare for the experience ahead.Franziska will be guiding you through an Empowerment Flow, a dynamic practice blending yoga with self-expression to unlock deeper truths within you. This method moves beyond traditional poses, inviting you to use movement, writing, art, and dialogue to explore your inner landscape and promote self-discovery.Next a facilitated women’s circle will provide a sacred space for shared experiences, journaling, and discussions on living in harmony with our natural cycles.Cacao Ceremony - Franziska invites you to a heart-opening cacao ceremony for women. Creating a sacred space for connection and inner wisdom, the power of ceremonial cacao offers a nurturing environment. Ceremonial cacao is a minimally processed, nutrient-dense superfood rich in antioxidants, known for its healing properties. Release emotions, spark creativity, balance your heart, and foster self-love in this mindful experience.We also have a connection corner, offering tarot, aromatherapy, and journaling prompts for introspection.We'll end with a nourishing meal, designed around women's hormonal healthHealthy snacks, herbal tea, detox water and essential oils available throughout the day. A mindful dinner and guided relaxation practice will allow us to integrate our experiences and nourish both body and soul.Join us in celebrating the beauty of being nature embodied—through movement, connection, and nurturance, guided by the wisdom and presence of Sanjana and Franzi.This experience will be a digital detox -absolutely no phones for 5 hours (you'll keep them in a basket), as we believe only after a few hours of disconnection from your phone can you reconnect with your body.📍Location: the Studio by Copper+Cloves🗓️ Date & Time: March 9th, 3pm to 8pm🎟️ Investment: ₹3500 plus taxes (if more than one person books, there is a significant 15% discount per booking if you book as a pair or group- so grab your girlfriends, sister or mum and join us for this retreat.

organizer.name: Copper + Cloves

name: Cordyceps Powered Strength Flow with Nuvedo
description: We are exciting to bring to you a one of a kind experience at the Studio by Copper + Cloves this Women's Day Weekend - exclusively for women!Nuvedo X Copper + Cloves which is all about exploring and experiencing the amazing healing power of mushrooms!The morning will start with an interaction understanding about the properties of functional mushrooms and how they are harvested.At the start of the yoga class, led by the wonderful Sukriti, you will receive Cordyceps mushroom extract dose, which has these known properties:Supports energy and endurancePromotes oxygen utilisation and energy metabolism.Supports occasional stress adaptabilityImproves athletic performanceImproves metabolic functionHas anti-inflammatory and anti-aging propertiesThe 60 minute practice will be followed by a sharing feast at the Studio by the Copper + Cloves chef team.We will incorporate functional mushrooms into the brunch, from a pan-fried Lion's mane sandwich, to reishi - cacao oat jars.We're so excited about this unique event because it’s more than just a yoga session or a brunch, it’s an experience that designed to nourish your body, mind, and soul.Imagine flowing through a yoga class where your breath and movement are perfectly in sync, supported by the magic of functional mushrooms. As you receive these powerful extracts, you’ll feel more grounded, connected, and fully present in your body.Afterward, we’ll come together for a heartwarming sharing feast, an opportunity to connect with like-minded souls over delicious, nutrient-packed food. You’ll get to savour incredible dishes infused with functional mushrooms, experiencing their benefits firsthand while learning how they can support your well-being.And to make it even more special, the amazing team from Nuvedo will guide you on a deep dive into the fascinating world of mushrooms. They’ll share why these extracts are so unique and how they can enhance your health in ways you never imagined.It’s going to be an unforgettable experience filled with connection, learning, and nourishment. We can’t wait to share it with you!This will be a truly special experience - if you have ever been curious about functional mushrooms and how they could support your health journey, this is the event for you!

name: Vizag's Non-Veg Tiffin Series
description: Anu Aunty’s Andhra Non-Veg Breakfast at TijouriThere’s something deeply comforting about a meal made with love, and Anu Aunty has spent a lifetime doing just that. Hailing from Vizag, she mastered Andhra home cooking at 16, turning her passion into a small yet beloved business.While Bangalore has many Andhra restaurants, nowhere will you find a traditional non-veg Andhra breakfast—a weekend ritual in many homes.For the first time, Tijouri brings you this nostalgic feast.Her menu features: Soft Pooris, Homemade Onion Vada, Upma, Idli & DosaMutton Curry, Natu Kodi Pulusu (country chicken curry), Prawns with Ridge Gourd, Bagara Rice & Potato CurrySignature Pickles – Tomato, Ginger & Chicken Payasam, Boorelu & Bellam BoondhiTerms & Conditions:Please arrive punctually.Late arrivals may miss the first few courses.Booking Fee are non-refundable under all circumstances once booked.Tickets are transferrable to a third party.No shows/ cancellations will not be refunded, but you can reschedule your booking for within the week 48hrs before your slot is due.Alcohol will not be served to guests under the age of 21No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.The booking fee total includes the online transaction fee.Parking at the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet is available.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. In case you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.

location.address: 1, Palace Rd, Ambedkar Veedhi, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

name: Tribute to Midnight Diner: Tokyo by Chef Anumitra
description: Bento Bento Presents: A Tribute to Midnight Diner – Tokyo Stories by Chef AnumitraDuring the days of pandemic binge-watching, one series that captured hearts worldwide was the gentle and deeply human Midnight Diner: Tokyo Stories. Inspired by its warmth and storytelling, Chef Anumitra—after her successful Studio Ghibli tribute pop-up—now brings a heartfelt culinary homage to this beloved series at Bento Bento in 2025.Just like in Midnight Diner, where a late-night eatery in Tokyo serves dishes that resonate deeply with its customers' emotions and stories, this pop-up will offer a curated menu featuring comfort dishes that bring both nostalgia and joy, featuring authentic Japanese ingredients, such as umeboshi, katsuobushi soyu, and Japanese mayo. Don't miss this chance to be a part of a comforting late-night community, in our cozy yet cute space, Bento Bento in Indiranagar.Menu: Midnight Diner – Tokyo StoriesStartersUmeboshi Onigiri (Veg) – A traditional rice ball, sticky rice encases the iconic Japanese pickled plum, balancing tartness and umami.Corn Dog (Veg) – A Japanese take on the classic street food, featuring a crispy, golden-brown batter.Ham Cutlet – Breaded and fried ham, offering a crispy exterior and tender, flavourful inside.Chicken Cheese Katsu – A Japanese-style chicken cutlet, with a melted cheese centre, encased in crisp panko.‘Octopus’ Wieners – Sausages carved into octopus shapes and deep-fried to perfection, a nostalgic favourite from Japanese lunchboxes.MainsTanmen (Veg Ramen) – A light yet flavourful vegetable ramen, comforting and wholesome.Tonteki – A pan-seared pork steak glazed with a savoury-sweet sauce, served with a side of greens.Crab Toshikoshi Soba – A dish traditionally eaten on New Year's Eve, featuring soba noodles in a light broth with crabsticks.Oyakodon – A beloved rice bowl dish featuring simmered chicken, egg, and onions in a savoury dashi sauce.Pork Miso Soup Set Menu – A hearty miso soup enriched with tender pork, served with rice and pickles.Sautéed Yam Set Menu (Veg) – A simple yet nourishing dish highlighting the natural sweetness of sautéed yam, served with rice and miso soup.Sides (Small Plates)Egg Tofu – A silky, custard-like tofu made with eggs, served chilled, with a light soy-based sauce.Pickled Napa Cabbage – A refreshing and crunchy pickled side dish to cleanse the palate. Potato Salad – A Japanese-style creamy potato salad with crunchy vegetables, eggs, and hints of mustard.Rice with Katsuobushi Soyu – Steamed rice topped with bonito flakes and seasoned soy sauce.Rice with Butter Soyu – A simple yet indulgent dish of warm rice mixed with butter and soy sauce. Boba, Beverages & Desserts also available!

location.name: Bento Bento
location.address: 197, Paramahansa Yogananda Rd, Binnamangala, Hoysala Nagar, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India

name: Tribute to Midnight Diner: Tokyo by Chef Anumitra
description: Bento Bento Presents: A Tribute to Midnight Diner – Tokyo Stories by Chef AnumitraDuring the days of pandemic binge-watching, one series that captured hearts worldwide was the gentle and deeply human Midnight Diner: Tokyo Stories. Inspired by its warmth and storytelling, Chef Anumitra—after her successful Studio Ghibli tribute pop-up—now brings a heartfelt culinary homage to this beloved series at Bento Bento in 2025.Just like in Midnight Diner, where a late-night eatery in Tokyo serves dishes that resonate deeply with its customers' emotions and stories, this pop-up will offer a curated menu featuring comfort dishes that bring both nostalgia and joy, featuring authentic Japanese ingredients, such as umeboshi, katsuobushi soyu, and Japanese mayo. Don't miss this chance to be a part of a comforting late-night community, in our cozy yet cute space, Bento Bento in Indiranagar.Menu: Midnight Diner – Tokyo StoriesStartersUmeboshi Onigiri (Veg) – A traditional rice ball, sticky rice encases the iconic Japanese pickled plum, balancing tartness and umami.Corn Dog (Veg) – A Japanese take on the classic street food, featuring a crispy, golden-brown batter.Ham Cutlet – Breaded and fried ham, offering a crispy exterior and tender, flavourful inside.Chicken Cheese Katsu – A Japanese-style chicken cutlet, with a melted cheese centre, encased in crisp panko.‘Octopus’ Wieners – Sausages carved into octopus shapes and deep-fried to perfection, a nostalgic favourite from Japanese lunchboxes.MainsTanmen (Veg Ramen) – A light yet flavourful vegetable ramen, comforting and wholesome.Tonteki – A pan-seared pork steak glazed with a savoury-sweet sauce, served with a side of greens.Crab Toshikoshi Soba – A dish traditionally eaten on New Year's Eve, featuring soba noodles in a light broth with crabsticks.Oyakodon – A beloved rice bowl dish featuring simmered chicken, egg, and onions in a savoury dashi sauce.Pork Miso Soup Set Menu – A hearty miso soup enriched with tender pork, served with rice and pickles.Sautéed Yam Set Menu (Veg) – A simple yet nourishing dish highlighting the natural sweetness of sautéed yam, served with rice and miso soup.Sides (Small Plates)Egg Tofu – A silky, custard-like tofu made with eggs, served chilled, with a light soy-based sauce.Pickled Napa Cabbage – A refreshing and crunchy pickled side dish to cleanse the palate. Potato Salad – A Japanese-style creamy potato salad with crunchy vegetables, eggs, and hints of mustard.Rice with Katsuobushi Soyu – Steamed rice topped with bonito flakes and seasoned soy sauce.Rice with Butter Soyu – A simple yet indulgent dish of warm rice mixed with butter and soy sauce. Boba, Beverages & Desserts also available!

location.name: Bento Bento
location.address: 197, Paramahansa Yogananda Rd, Binnamangala, Hoysala Nagar, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India

name: Pop Art Painting Workshop
description: 🎨✨ Unleash Your Inner Pop Icon! ✨🎨Join us for an exhilarating Pop Art Workshop at Fired Up in WhiteField, Bangalore! Get ready to dive into the vibrant world of pop art with an inspiring introduction on its history—exploring legendary pop artists and their iconic works (yes, including the unforgettable Andy Warhol)! 🌟🎭👩‍🎨 Age Group: All Ages Welcome!Workshop Highlights:Introduction to Pop Art: Discover the evolution of pop art and learn about its legendary artists and their masterpieces.Hands-On Session: Follow a simple, step-by-step technique to create your own pop art portrait in Andy Warhol style using acrylic paints on cartridge sheets.Sketching Made Easy: Begin by drawing initial sketches. Not confident with sketching? No worries—carbon papers will be provided!Personalized Artwork: Choose one image from 4 exclusive options provided to guide your portrait creation.Take Home: Your very own finished A3-size pop art masterpiece!So, what are you waiting for? Let’s create, innovate, and bring the bold spirit of pop art to life!📞 Enroll Now!

location.address: Shop No. 5, 153 Biere St, Hagadur Main Rd, Prestige Ozone, Whitefield, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560066, India

organizer.name: Fired Up
organizer.description: Dive into a world of creativity at Bangalore's premier craft studio. Our workshops provide all tools and supplies for a memorable experience, perfect for summer camps, weekend activities, birthdays, date activities, girls' nights out, or family fun.

name: The Analog Club
description: Step back in time at The Analog Club, a new event series by the Studio by Copper + Cloves.Imagine walking into a busy cafe and seeing not a single phone, no-one taking selfies and no one around you scrolling. Disconnect from devices for 3 hours of unplugged experience—we'll have books, board games, music, crochet, and of course, food! But this isn't about structured activities or organised fun, just genuine connection and relaxation. The event will be fluid- you can dip into activities if you want, or you can just chat to new people or graze at our high tea counter!Meet new friends, sketch, or read a book in quiet solitude (without being surrounded by people lost in their phones).We will not be doing social media on our phones at the event, we will only take photos with a camera.Embrace the analog experience, slow down, and reconnect in this crazy digital age! **Strictly no devices (no laptops, ipads, and you will be asked to keep your phone in a basket or in your bag- not in your pocket and no where on a table. Except e-books)**Tickets are for entry and unlimited high tea from our renowned deli counter.

location.name: Copper + Cloves

name: Holi Pizza Picnic
description: Holi + DIY Pizza Party at Lakehouse Garden Cafe!Get ready for a colourful, fun-filled Holi celebration like never before! Luca & Raf's Kitchen is teaming up with The LooRoo Club to bring you an exciting Holi + DIY Pizza Party at the beautiful Lakehouse Garden Cafe! For Kids Aged 3-8 – This isn’t just a Holi party… it’s a pizza adventure too!

organizer.name: The LooRoo Club
organizer.description: The LooRoo Club (TLC) is a little world of big adventures. We create playful, nature-inspired experiences for kids - where stories come alive, curiosity runs wild, and messy hands mean happy hearts.

name: Jazz Night with Chronic Blues Circus
description: Grandmasters of Bangalore's live music scene, The Chronic Blues Circuskickstarted their incredible journey back in 1991 and have never lookedback. These folks aren't just another band; they're pioneers of "BangaloreBlues."Based in Bangalore, they've performed at numerous venues across thecity, most recently at Hard Rock Café and Fandom at Gilly’s Redefined.Beyond the bounds of the city, The Chronic Blues Circus has headlined gigsacross India, including Delhi, Mumbai, Goa, and Gokarna, among others.Apart from their own compositions, the band also pays tributes to Bluesmasters like Muddy Waters, John Mayall, Paul Butterfield, Rory Gallager,Willie Dixon, Maggie Bell, Traffic, the Grateful Dead as well ascontemporary blues artists like Keb Mo.

name: Pop-Up Brunch with Bao To Me
description: Bao to Me started as an idea between three friends from Bangalore who wanted to bring vibrant Pan-Asian flavors to your plate—going beyond just baos. It’s a place where authenticity, tradition, and a touch of fun come together in every dish.Inspired by our chef’s childhood and Bangalore’s rich culinary heritage, our food philosophy is all about blending tradition with creativity. We serve the kind of food we’ve always wanted to eat—authentic, unpretentious, and ridiculously good.

name: Stargazing Retreat 🌌 | Overnight Stay
description: 🌌 Experience the Universe Like Never Before! 🌠Escape the city lights and immerse yourself in a night of celestial wonder at our Overnight Astro Camp, just a 2-hour drive from Bangalore. Experience breathtaking views of the night sky as you observe planets, galaxies, and constellations through powerful telescopes. Engage in guided stargazing sessions, astrophotography, and cosmic storytelling, all set in a serene natural landscape. Whether you're an astronomy enthusiast or just looking for a magical night under the stars, this is an experience you won’t want to miss! ✨📅 Date: Check in: 15th (01:00 PM IST) Check Out: 16th March (11:00 AM IST)📍 Location: Atmaveda Shivasamudra (https://maps.app.goo.gl/mxvzyAF25Pe7mb9N9)⏳ Limited Spots Only! Book now and travel beyond our world! 🚀✨

location.address: Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

name: Persian Mandala Painting Workshop
description: Persian mandalas are a significant element in Persian art and architecture, known for their intricate geometric patterns and deep symbolic meanings. While mandalas are often associated with India and Buddhism, they have also been widely used in Persian design to represent harmony and the universe.In this workshop, you’ll create your own Persian mandala painting on A3 cartridge sheets using acrylic colors.Perfect activity for Teens and Adults

location.address: Shop No. 5, 153 Biere St, Hagadur Main Rd, Prestige Ozone, Whitefield, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560066, India

name: Cuban Art Workshop
description: 🎨 Escape to Havana Without Leaving Town! Experience the vibrant culture, colors, and stories of Cuba through art.Immerse yourself in the vibrant world of Cuban contemporary art, rich in history and bold expression. Choose between two iconic themes—urban landscapes or the Cuban woman with cigars—and bring them to life with acrylics on cartridge sheets. Experience the essence of Havana through color and culture in this unforgettable workshop and take home one A3 size masterpiece!🌈 Havana Hues & Expressive Views! Play with bold, fiery colors and expressive strokes to bring your artwork to life.🖌 No Experience? No Problem! Whether you're a pro or just love to dabble, this workshop is all about creativity and fun.

name: Macrame Workshop
description: Get Knotty with Macramé!Dive headfirst into the art of macramé and craft your own boho-chic mini wall hanging or car charm—plus a stylish keychain to match! Whether you're a total newbie or a knot-tying pro, this workshop is all about fun, creativity, and good vibes.You’ll learn essential macramé techniques, play with gorgeous cords, and walk away with two handmade creations that are both stylish and functional. And don’t worry about supplies—we’ve got everything covered! Just bring your enthusiasm, and let's get knotty!Perfect for a creative break, a fun hangout, or a solo artsy adventure. See you there!Ages: Adults and Kids 10 +
